name: Influence Network Mapping
description: Training in identifying and mapping networks of influence used in psychological operations, disinformation campaigns, and propaganda distribution.

cards.title: Introduction to Influence Networks
cards.description: Understanding how influence networks operate to shape public perception and behavior.
bulletpoints: Defining influence networks in media, politics, and social movements.
Recognizing the key actors in psychological operations.
Differentiating organic vs. artificial influence campaigns.
cards.summaryText: Define influence webs, list psyops actors, and separate organic buzz from engineered pushes.

cards.title: Identifying Key Nodes in Influence Networks
cards.description: Detecting the most influential individuals and groups within a network.
bulletpoints: Analyzing key opinion leaders and their reach.
Understanding gatekeeping and agenda-setting roles.
Mapping direct and indirect connections within influence networks.
cards.summaryText: Profile opinion leaders, note gatekeepers, and chart how power flows through the network.

cards.title: Tracking Narrative Propagation
cards.description: Following the flow of narratives through digital and traditional media ecosystems.
bulletpoints: Identifying the origin points of viral misinformation.
Understanding amplification tactics used in coordinated campaigns.
Using OSINT tools to trace the spread of narratives.
cards.summaryText: Trace narrative origins, log amplification paths, and use OSINT to follow signal spread.

cards.title: Recognizing Controlled Opposition
cards.description: Detecting influence agents posing as independent voices while serving hidden agendas.
bulletpoints: Identifying inconsistencies in messaging patterns.
Analyzing funding sources and affiliations.
Using behavioral analysis to detect scripted narratives.
cards.summaryText: Expose scripted dissent, audit funding trails, and flag behavior that betrays hidden agendas.

cards.title: Bot and Sockpuppet Account Detection
cards.description: Identifying automated and fake social media accounts used to manipulate narratives.
bulletpoints: Recognizing engagement anomalies and inorganic activity spikes.
Using network graphing tools to map coordinated bot behavior.
Distinguishing AI-generated vs. human-authored content.
cards.summaryText: Spot bot spikes, map coordinated clusters, and distinguish AI chatter from human voices.

cards.title: Disrupting Influence Networks
cards.description: Strategies to neutralize the effectiveness of coordinated disinformation networks.
bulletpoints: Creating counter-narratives to weaken disinformation campaigns.
Identifying and exposing key propagators of false narratives.
Using ethical hacking and OSINT techniques to dismantle influence operations.
cards.summaryText: Launch counter-stories, unmask propagators, and wield ethical OSINT to break networks apart.

cards.title: Analyzing Corporate & State Influence Operations
cards.description: Mapping how corporations, intelligence agencies, and governments shape public perception.
bulletpoints: Recognizing corporate media control and narrative alignment.
Tracing the financial and institutional connections behind media outlets.
Understanding covert state-sponsored disinformation strategies.
cards.summaryText: Decode corporate-state alliances, follow funding pipelines, and log covert propaganda tactics.

cards.title: Psychological Manipulation Tactics in Influence Networks
cards.description: Breaking down the psychological methods used to condition public perception.
bulletpoints: Recognizing the use of fear, division, and emotional appeals.
Analyzing linguistic patterns and framing techniques.
Identifying social engineering tactics in influence campaigns.
cards.summaryText: Identify emotional levers, analyze framing language, and catch social engineering in motion.

cards.title: Open-Source Intelligence (OSINT) for Influence Mapping
cards.description: Leveraging OSINT methodologies to track, analyze, and expose influence networks.
bulletpoints: Using advanced search queries and data mining for network analysis.
Mapping social media connections and content dissemination.
Employing visualization tools to track influence campaigns.
cards.summaryText: Combine search hacks, map social graphs, and visualize influence footprints across platforms.

cards.title: Future Trends in Influence Warfare
cards.description: Exploring how influence networks will evolve with AI, deepfakes, and next-gen PsyOps.
bulletpoints: Understanding the integration of AI in psychological operations.
Predicting emerging influence tactics in the digital age.
Developing countermeasures for next-generation narrative warfare.
